# The `RemoveRedundantDebugValues.cpp` File Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

The <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-removeredundantdebugvalues-cpp-/removeredundantdebugvalues">RemoveRedundantDebugValues</a> pass removes redundant DBG&#95;VALUEs that appear in MIR after the register allocator. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

The <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-removeredundantdebugvalues-cpp-/removeredundantdebugvalues">RemoveRedundantDebugValues</a> pass removes redundant DBG&#95;VALUEs that appear in MIR after the register allocator.

<SectionDefinition>

<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This analysis aims to remove redundant DBG&#95;VALUEs by going forward</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// in the basic block by considering the first DBG&#95;VALUE as a valid</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// until its first (location) operand is not clobbered/modified.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For example:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   (1) DBG&#95;VALUE $edi, !&quot;var1&quot;, ...</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// in this case, we can remove (3).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// TODO: Support DBG&#95;VALUE&#95;LIST and other debug instructions.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This analysis aims to remove redundant DBG&#95;VALUEs by going backward</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// in the basic block and removing all but the last DBG&#95;VALUE for any</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// given variable in a set of consecutive DBG&#95;VALUE instructions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For example:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   (1) DBG&#95;VALUE $edi, !&quot;var1&quot;, ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   (2) DBG&#95;VALUE $esi, !&quot;var2&quot;, ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   (3) DBG&#95;VALUE $edi, !&quot;var1&quot;, ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// in this case, we can remove (1).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156" lineLink="#ab500564693e7d4da8ba1c02c723a057a"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="#ab500564693e7d4da8ba1c02c723a057a">reduceDbgValsBackwardScan</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#a5958512eae2979bd2eb383977996a600">MBB</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We have already encountered the value for this variable,</span></CodeLine>
